title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Consumer
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Consumer 

Protection) (Commission for Aviation Regulation) Regulations 2021. 

Interpretation
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited european union (consumer protection) (commission aviation regulation) regulation 2021 interpretation

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 2. (1) In these Regulations –
text_raw:
2. (1) In these Regulations – 

“Act of 1995” means the Package Holidays and Travel Trade Act 1995 
(No. 17 of 1995); 
“Act of 2001” means the Aviation Regulation Act 2001 (No. 1 of 2001); 
 “Council Regulation” means Regulation (EU) 2017/2394 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 12 December 20172 on cooperation between national authorities responsible for the enforcement of 
consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004; 

“Commission” means the Commission for Aviation Regulation. 

(2) A word or expression that is used in these Regulations and which is 
also used in the Council Regulation has, unless the context otherwise requires, 
the same meaning in these Regulations as it has in the Council Regulation. 

Designation of Competent Authority

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 3. The Commission for Aviation Regulation is designated as the
text_raw:
3. The Commission for Aviation Regulation is designated as the 
competent authority under Article 5(1) of the Council Regulation for the 
enforcement of those laws that protect consumers’ interests specified in column 
3 to the Schedule of S.I. No. 14 of 2020 at reference numbers 8, 10, 15 and 25. 

1 OJ No L 345 27.12.2017, p. 1. 
2 OJ No L 345 27.12.2017, p.1. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th April, 2021.

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 4. (1) For the purposes of investigations relating to the Council Regulation,
text_raw:
4. (1) For the purposes of investigations relating to the Council Regulation, 
the Commission shall have the investigation powers referred to in Article 9(3) 
of the Council Regulation. 

(2) For the purpose of enforcement of the Council Regulation, the 
Commission shall have the enforcement powers referred to in Article 9(4) (a) 
to (g) of the Council Regulation. 

(3) The Commission – 

(a) 

shall have the power to start investigations or proceedings in 
accordance with Article 9(6) of the Council Regulation, and 

(b) may publish any final decision, traders commitments or orders 
adopted pursuant to the Council Regulation in accordance with 
Article 9(7) of the Council Regulation. 

(4) The powers referred to in paragraphs (1), (2) and (3) shall be exercised 

by the Commission in accordance with Article 10 of the Council Regulation. 

Offences

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 5. (1) For the purposes of Article 9(4)(h) of the Council Regulation and the
text_raw:
5. (1) For the purposes of Article 9(4)(h) of the Council Regulation and the 
powers of enforcement conferred on the Commission under Regulation 5(2), a 
person who fails to comply with a decision, order, interim measure, trader’s 
commitment or other measure specified in Article - 

(a) 9(4)(a), 

(b) 9(4)(b), 

(c) 

9(4)(c), 

(d) 9(4)(d), 

(e) 

9(4)(e), 

(f) 

9(4)(f), or 

(g) 9(4)(g)(i) to (iii), 

of the Council Regulation shall be guilty of an offence. 

(2) Where a person commits an intra-Union infringement, a widespread 
infringement or a widespread infringement with a Union dimension relating to 
a national measure for which the Commission is designated as the competent 
authority under Article 5(1) of the Council Regulation, he or she commits an 
offence. 

(3) For the purposes of paragraph (2) and Regulation 6 (2), a “national 

measure” means the following: 

(a) 

(b) 
(c) 

section 20 of the Transport (Tour Operators and Travel Agents) 
Act, 1982 (No. 3 of 1982); 
section 6 of the Act of 1995; 
sections 42, 45A of the Act of 2001; 

 
 
 4 [195] 

(d) European Communities (Rights of Disabled Persons and Persons 
With Reduced Mobility When Travelling By Air) Regulations 
2008 (S.I. No. 299 of 2008); 

(f) Regulation No. 5 of European Communities (Common Rules for 
the Operation of Air Services in the Community) Regulations 
2008 (S.I. No. 426 of 2008). 

Penalties

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: 6. (1) A person who commits an offence under Regulation 5 (1) shall be
text_raw:
6. (1) A person who commits an offence under Regulation 5 (1) shall be 
liable on summary conviction to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term 
not exceeding 12 months, or to both. 

(2) Where a person commits an offence under a national measure and, the 
offence concerned also constitutes an offence under Regulation 6(2), the 
penalty in respect of the second mentioned offence shall be the penalty 
specified in the national measure in respect of the first mentioned offence 
concerned. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 April, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [195] 5

title: consumer protection laws and repealing Regulation (EC) No. 2006/2004, in so
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

The purpose of these Regulations is to implement Regulation (EU) 2017/2394 
on cooperation between national authorities responsible for the enforcement of 
consumer protection laws in so far as Regulation (EU) 2017/2394 relates to 
national measures concerning consumers’ interests specified in column 3 to the 
Schedule of S.I. No. 14 of 2020 at reference numbers 8, 10, 15 and 25. These 
Regulations provide the Commission for Aviation Regulation with the 
investigation and enforcement powers required under Article 9 of the Council 
Regulation. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [195]
